newsitem.title: USA: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Big trades in Bay, Republic.
newsitem.headline: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Big trades in Bay, Republic.

text.p: A big spread crossed in options on shares of Bay Networks Inc and an institutional investor placed a sizable bullish bet in Republic Industries Inc, options traders said Tuesday.
The Bay Networks July 22-1/2 call and August 22-1/2 call each traded about 11,900 contracts.
Jon Najarian, president of Mercury Trading, the designated primary market maker in Bay Network options, said an institution rolled the July position out to August for a customer.
In afternoon trading, Bay Network shares were up 9/16 at 27-3/4.
In Republic Industries, an institutional investor bought 6,000 January 2000 20 puts and sold 6,000 January 2000 30 calls, a market maker said. He added that the investor also bought 480,000 shares.
"It was a real bullish, real bullish trade," he said, adding that the investor appears to be growing bullish on Republic's plan to buy auto dealerships and rental agencies.
On Tuesday, Republic said it agreed to acquire Snappy Car Rental Inc of Tulsa, Okla. for $26 million in cash or stock.
The market maker said interest in Republic options has been increasing recently but that Tuesday's action in the long term options appeared to come from a new investor.
"I think this is a new bet," he said.
In other activity, traders said investors were lining up positions ahead of second quarter earnings reports, which are beginning to trickle in. The onslaught of earnings begins next week.
Among the first key companies to report is Motorola Inc, which is scheduled to release second quarter numbers after the close of trading Tuesday.
In late action, Motorola shares were up 1-1/4 at 81-5/8.
Among the Motorola options, the July 85 call traded nearly 4,300 contracts and the July 80 call traded more than 4,100.
The Motorola calls were busy out to the January series, where the 70 strike option traded 1,115 contracts and the 60 strike traded 1,045.
On the put side, the July 80 traded about 4,200 contracts and the July 75 traded 3,760.
According to First Call, analysts' consensus estimate for Motorola's second quarter is $0.56 a share, up from $0.54 last year. The estimate excludes a $170 million charge.
One options analyst said put volume in PairGain Technologies Inc was particularly heavy Monday ahead of its earnings Wednesday, which suggested some investors were betting on disappointing numbers.
On Tuesday, the stock was up 2 at 17-7/8 in active trading.

Among the options, the July 15 put was most active, with turnover of 1,355 contracts. The July 17-1/2 call traded nearly 1,300 contracts and the July 20 call traded 760. The July 17-1/2 and 22-1/2 put each traded well over 600 contracts.
